sourceMeaningMnemonic: You take this <radical>comb</radical>, break the handle off, and use it to <radical>stamp</radical> your official <kanji>seal</kanji> of approval onto a document. It's kind of a messy <kanji>mark</kanji>ing process, but it gets the job done.
meaningInfo: Imagine breaking and bending a comb so you can use it to stamp your seal onto things.
readingMnemonic: You need this <kanji>seal</kanji> to stay at an <reading>inn</reading> (<ja>いん</ja>). All inns require official paperwork, so you had to improvise and make a seal on the fly.
readingInfo: Hopefully the inn accepts this seal... or you aren't going to have a place to sleep tonight. And it kind of just looks like you dipped a comb in ink and pressed it around on some paper.
